ygData.subject: Re: New character and Wisdom
ygData.msgSnippet: Hail, My experiences are that a skill raises much faster if you put the initial one practice on it once you reach the level requirements for it, some skills
ygData.messageBody:
Hail,

My experiences are that a skill raises much faster if you put the initial
one practice on it once you reach the level requirements for it, some skills
doesnt seem to raise at all if you dont(dodge). Although if you see the
skill on the right side when you are practicing at your guildmaster it
should raise eventually but from 0 skill it will take quite a long time to
get the first increase in it.


// Njelm 10 th level Paladin
Fennin Ro server

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Rodney Miller [SMTP:RMiller@...]
> Sent: den 28 april 1999 17:22
> To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
> Subject: [eqpaladin] Re: New character and Wisdom
>
> From: Rodney Miller <RMiller@...>
>
> One thing that I have noticed, (correct me if I am wrong), is that if I
> haven't practiced at least one time with my Guildmaster on a type of spell
> (abjuration for instance) my experience does not increase in that spell
> type
> until I do. So it may seem that you can't use a spell or that it is not
> working well, but you need to practice it with the Guildmaster at least
> once
> to kind of "kick start" the spell. This is the way it has worked for me.
> If anyone has any more information on practicing and spells, let me know.
> I
> am just about to go to level 11 and will be curious as to where to utilize
> my practices.
>
> Grod
> 10th Level Paladin (almost 11)
> Innoruuk Server
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Tyler [mailto:jsabos@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, April 28, 1999 9:35 AM
> To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqpaladin] Re: New character and Wisdom
>
>
> From: Tyler <jsabos@...>
>
> I currently have a lvl 13 human paladin with 85 wisdom and have never had
> a
> problem at all with casting my spells (except the ocassional fail) =).
>
> Stuart Christian wrote:
>
> > From: "Stuart Christian" <stuartc@...>
> >
> > I made a Paladin again last night, I had one that made it to level 5
> then
> I
> > deleted him because I couldn't make any exp, and I realized once I hit
> level
> > 4 that I might not put enough points into Wisdom to be able to cast all
> the
> > spells when I first get them. I had this same problem with my SK where
> I
> > wasn't able to cast 2 of my spells until level 11. This was one of the
> > reasons why I quit playing him, the other because I like to explore and
> it's
> > very difficult when you're a huge Troll. So, I was wondering if 90
> Wisdom
> > is enough to be able to cast all the spells when I get them. I'm really
> > afraid of playing this character up to level 50 and still not be able to
> > cast Revive(49) or something to that effect. My race is a Dwarf if that
> > effects it. Thanks.
> >
> > -Kalamar (E'ci)
> >
